com.jgaap.gui.guiComponents
Class StepWizard

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  com.jgaap.gui.guiComponents.StepWizard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class StepWizard
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

Encapsulating class for several other classes in the guiComponents package. This class uses a StepProgressIndicator and a series of StepPanels to present the end-user with a wizard-like GUI, where StepPanels are shown one at a time with buttons to go to the next and previous steps, and the overall step progress is tracked and displayed.

Author:
Chuck Liddell
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constant Field Values

stepPI

private StepProgressIndicator stepPI
Tracks the progress visually for the user, so they can see what step they are on.

stepsContainer

private javax.swing.JPanel stepsContainer
Stores the StepPanels used to represent the different steps in this wizard. StepPanels are shown one at a time using a CardLayout.

prevButton

private javax.swing.JButton prevButton
The buttons used to change step in the wizard.

private javax.swing.JButton nextButton
The buttons used to change step in the wizard.

addStep

public void addStep(StepPanel newStep)
Add a step to this wizard by passing a StepPanel to this method. Steps will be displayed in the wizard in the order they are added.

Parameters:
newStep - the new step to be added to this wizard
